p.seg: âcimôwin kayâs manitôwi-kihiw otâcimowin . This is a story Spirit-Eagle told long ago.

êkot ê-kî-wîcihiwêt , mitâtaht ayiwâkês êh-ihtasiyit , ot êh-ntopayicik , ayâhciyiniwah ê-ntopayîstawâcik , êkwah wâhyaw êh-ayâcik ayahciyiniwah otaskiyihk , êkosi kîkisêpâ sipwêhtêwak , ê-waniskâcik . There where he went with a war party of some ten men or more on the war-path against the Blackfoot, when they were far into the Blackfoots' country, they got up one morning and started out.

êkwa kîtahtawêh ayahciyiniwak ês ê-kîh-nipahâcik mostoswah , êwakonih itohtêwak . Presently they came to some buffalos which the Blackfoot, apparently, had killed. LB on {itohtêwak}: The Cree are the third person, subject of this last verb; hence the sentence should properly read {... ayahciyiniwah ês ê-kîh-nipahâyit ...}, with the Blackfoot in the obviative form.
êkosi êkwah kotawêwak , ê-wîh-mîciwâcik wiyâs , êh-mîcisocik . So they made a fire, for they intended to make a meal, eating the meat.
mostoso-mêyah mâwacihtâwak , ê-wîh-pônahkik . They gathered buffalo-dung for fuel.

êkwah êkotah apwêwak , wiyâs êh-mah-manisahkik , êh-nah-nawacîcik , êkwah nîsoh ê-ispatinâyik êh-wâpahtahkik , ê-wîh-ntaw-âsawâpicik , nîso ê-sâkêwêcik . There they did the roasting, cutting slices of meat and making preserved meat; two of them, the while, ascending a rise in the land which they saw, to reconnoitre.

namoya iskw êh-mîcisocik , êwakonik kâ-natawahtâcik -- kîtahtawêh âstam itah ê-sakâsiyik misatimwah kâ-sâkêwêyit ; They had not yet eaten, when those scouts - suddenly on this side of a small grove some horses came forth;
kîtahtawêh ayahciyiniwah kâ-sâkêwêyit , êkwah êh-itâpicik , mîkiwâhpah ê-sâkamoyikih . soon a Blackfoot came forth; and when they looked that way, there the tops of some tents showed forth.

tapasîwak kônihk , sâkahikanis , êkotah pikoh kônah êh-apit , kwayask itah êyakonik nîso êyakonik kâ-ntawahtâcik . they fled on the snow, straight to a small lake that was all covered with snow, those two scouts.
êkwah ayahciyiniw sâkowêw , nêhih kâ-nâh-nawaciyit êh-wâpamât , êkwah owîcêwâkanah êh-nitômât . The Blackfoot gave the war-whoop, when he saw those who were preparing meat, to call his comrades.
êkosi nêki nêhiyawak tapasîwak , mistah ê-pasahcâyik êkotah êh-itâmocik . So these Cree fled, heading for a deep ravine.
ayahciyiniwak wîhkwêskawêwak nêhiyawah , êh-nôcihâcik . The Blackfoot surrounded the Cree in the chase.
êkwah ôki kônihk kâh-kî-kwayasitêcik kisiwâk wâpamêwak ôhi ayahciyiniwah . Those who had gone into the snow, saw the Blackfoot from close by.
êkwah pimipiciwak êkotah cîki , iskwêwak ê-nitawi-kapêsicik êkotah . They moved their camp close by there; the women went along to camp there.

apisîs pikoh tawâw , osâm mistahi ê-pasahcâk , êkotah pîhcâyihk nêhiyawak êh-ayâcik , ê-nôcihihcik . There was only a small opening, so narrow and deep was the ravine in which the Cree stayed when they were attacked.
êkwah ôki mistahi mâkwaciwak , nipîhk êh-akocihkik . And these men were very cold, lying in the water.

êkosi kônah êh-pakonênâcik , êh-itâpicik , kisiwâk iskwêwah êh-pimohtêyit , mîkiwâhpah kisiwâk êh-cimatêyikih . When they made a rift in the snow and looked out, there were the women walking by and the tents standing near.
êkwah matwêh-sâkowêwak ayâhciyiniwak . They heard the Blackfoot whooping.

êkwâ awah pêyak k-âkocihk kônihk , osîmah pêyak êkotah ayâyiwah , manitôwi-kihiw osîmah . One of the men who were lying in the snow had a younger brother with the other group; Spirit-Eagle's younger brother it was.

seg.gloss: “This noise of shooting is not as when quarter is shown.

p.seg: nisîm êkotah wîcihiwêw , itwêw manitôwi-kihiw . my brother is with them,” said Spirit-Eagle.

êkwah sâyiman ômisi itêw manitôwi-kihiwah :
kiyâm êkâ wiyah . Then Solomon spoke thus to Spirit-Eagle: “Better not.

seg.gloss: For no one will tell the tale, if all of us are slain.

seg.q: mâkah pimâtisiyahkoh , ômah ê-nîsiyahk kik-âcimonânaw , kîkinâhk takosiniyahkoh .
seg.gloss: But if we live, we two, we shall tell the tale, when we reach our camp.

seg.q: mâkah itohtêyahkoh , kahkiyaw nipahikawiyahkoh , nam âwiyak t-âcimôw nêtêh mîkiwâhpihk .
seg.gloss: But if we go there and all of us are killed, no one will tell it there at home.

p.seg: kîkinâhk takosiniyahkoh , kik-âcimonânaw , itwêw sâyiman . When we reach our camp, we shall tell the tale,” said Solomon.

moscis wâpamêwak ayâhciyiniwah êh-pâ-pasahkâpiyit , osâm kisiwâk êh-kapêsimostawâcik . Plainly they could see even when a Blackfoot blinked his eyes, so close had they camped to them. LB on {moscis}: For {moscih} or {moscih isih}. LB on {êh-pâ-pasahkâpiyit}: The initial element ({pasahk-}) is doubtful.
êkwah misatimwah kêkâc pâh-pistiskâkwak , ê-wîh-minihkwêyit . And they nearly were stepped on by the horses that came to drink.
aspapiwinah kikiskamwak misatimwak ; pîsâkanâpiy otâpêwak ê-sakikwêpisocik . The horses had saddles on; they were dragging reins, being all bridled.

omis îtwêw sâyiman :
têhcipayihotân ôkih misatimwak . Thus spoke Solomon: “Let us throw ourselves on these horses.

seg.gloss: No doubt they are bridled because they are swift.
They will not be able to catch up to us.”

p.seg:
êkosi ômisih itwêw manitôwi-kihiw :
nama wiyah nika-kîh-nakatâw nisîm . To this Spirit-Eagle answered thus: “I cannot leave my brother behind.
omah kâ-mâh-matwêwiyik êkotah aspin kîh-wîcihiwêw nisîm , itwêw manitôwi-kihiw . Over yonder where we hear the shots, is where my brother has gone with the rest,” said Spirit-Eagle.

êkwah êh-pôn-âpihtâ-kîsikâk , kîtahtawêh omis îtwêw sâyiman :
âta niwîh-kawacin ; âta wiyah niyah nikah-pimâtisin , itwêw , When noon had passed, Solomon spoke: “I am almost frozen to death; yet I shall live,” he said; LB on {nikah-pimâtisin}: I.e. “I feel sufficient mystic power in me to know that I shall live.”
kiya mâkah ? itêw manitôwi-kihiwah . “But as for you?” he said to Spirit-Eagle.

êkosi ômisi itwêw :
niya mînah nikah-pimâtisin , itwêw manitôwi-kihiw ; Then he answered thus: “I too shall live,” said Spirit-Eagle;

omis îtwêw sâyiman :
hâw , miscicâkanis ,
kisiwâk kikaw-osâpamitin , wîh-nipahikawiyinih , kikîh-isin . thus spoke Solomon: “Come, Coyote, 'From close by shalt thou see me when thou art in danger of being slain,' saidst thou to me.

seg.q:
êkwah ohtin ,
kisiwâk kik-ôsâpamitin wî-nipahikawiyinih , kikîh-isin .
seg.gloss: And Wind, 'From close by shalt thou see me, when thou art in danger of being slain,' saidst thou to me.
Thy blanket-robe I ask of thee;

p.seg: ninôhtê-pimâtisin , itwêw sâyiman . I long for life,” spoke Solomon.
êkosi ; pasikô , itêw manitôwi-kihiwah , “So there; arise,” said he to Spirit-Eagle,

seg.q: êkâ wiyah ohcih âpasâpih , k-ôsêhcâk awasêwêyinih .
seg.gloss: Do not look behind you when you pass the knoll.
I shall come close behind you.”

p.seg: êkosi manitôwi-kihiw sêkisiw kita-pasikôt , osâm kisiwâk êh-ayâyit ayahciyiniwah ; Then Spirit-Eagle was afraid to stand up, for the Blackfoot were close at hand;
mâskôc nistomitanaw tahkoskêwin êkoyikohk mîkiwâhpah êh-ayâyikih , êwako ohcih sêkisiw . because the tents were perhaps thirty steps away was why he feared.
êkwah sâyiman at-âskowêw . Then Solomon kept close behind him.
êy-osêhcâyik kisiwâk êkotah kîh-âkawêwêwak . They went to where a hill close by cut them off from sight.
misiwê sâpopêwak . They were drenched through.
êkwah nîpisiyah nântaw têpakohp misit êy-iskwâyikih , êkotah kisâtamwak . In a place where the willows were some seven feet high they stayed.
kîtahtawêh misi-yôtin ; êwakonih sâyiman kâ-kîh-nitômât kita-pimâcihikot . Soon a great wind blew; that was the one whom Solomon had called to save his life.
êkosi nanâskomôw . Accordingly he gave thanks.
mistahih mispon . There came a great fall of snow.
êkwah kêtayôwinisêwak , êh-pâsahkik otayôwinisiwâwah . they undressed and dried their clothes.
mistahih mâyi-kîsikâw . It was very bad weather.
êkosi êkwah êh-tipiskâk , misatimwah kimotiwak , ayâhciyiniwah otêmiyiwah , aspapiwinah ê-kikiskamiyit . So when night came, they stole horses, the Blackfoots' horses, all saddled.
êkwah tapasîwak . Then they fled.

êkwah oki nêhiyawak kâ-nôcihihcik ,
tapasîtân , itwêw pêyak . As for those Cree who were besieged, “Let us flee,” said one.
êkwah ospwâkana oyaskinahêw ; miyêw nâpêwah kita-nitonamiyit êh-tawâk itah . Then he filled a pipe; he gave it to a man who was to look for an opening.
takohtêw kâwih : He came back:
êkotah âta wiya cawâsiw , itwêw . “Over here is, to be sure, a small opening,” he said.
êkwah wawêyîwak . Then they made ready.

êkwah oskinîkiw-iyinîs otâhk ê-kaskâwikanêhoht ,
ê-wîh-ntawih-minihkwêyâhk nipiy , itwêwak nâpêwak . And, as a young lad had been shot in the stomach, “We are only going to get a drink of water,” said the men.
êkwah awa nâpêsis ayih acosisah otinam . Then the lad took some arrows.
pêyak ayahciyiniw nika-nipahâw , itwêw awah nâpêsis kâ-wîh-nakatiht . I shall kill a Blackfoot,” said the lad who was to be abandoned.
êkwah nâpêwak ôkih tapasîwak . Then those men fled.

kotak nâpêw êh-pakocêhoht , âsay êh-miyâskahkik mîkiwâhpah ,
pitah nik-âyiwêpin ; ispisohtêk , itwêw awah kâ-pakocêhoht . Another man who had been wounded in the side, when they had already passed the camp, “Let me rest a bit; do you go on ahead,” said he who had been wounded in the side.
êkosi êyâpic anohc nam êskwa takosin . To this day he has not arrived.
êkwah ôki mosêskatêwak kâ-tapasîcik , ê-kisinâk . And they fled bare in the cold.
êkosi nîso nipahâwak êwokonik anikih . Thus two of these people were killed.
êkwah ayahciyiniwah mihcêt kî-nipahêwak ; okimâwah mistahi kî-nipahêwak . They had killed many Blackfoot; they had killed many chieftains.
êkosi wiy êkwah kîh-takosinwak wîkiwâhk ; And so they reached home;
mistahi kih-miyawâtamwak , osâm mihcêt ê-kîh-nôcihikocik ayâhciyiniwah . they rejoiced greatly because they had been so close pressed by the Blackfoot.
êkosih . That is all.
êkosi anah nêhiyâsis iskwêyâc wiyah kîh-nipahêw ayâhciyiniwah , ê-wîh-otihtinikot ; But as for that Cree lad, at the very last he killed a Blackfoot, as they were about to reach him;
pêyak nipahêw iskwêyâc wiyah . one he killed at the very last.
manitôwi-minahikoskâhk isiyihkâtêw êkotah kâ-kîh-nôcihihcik . Spirit-Spruce-Grove is the name of the place where they were besieged.
êkwah mistahi kîh-manitôwiw sâyiman k-oh-pimâtisicik . Greatly gifted with spirit power was Solomon; through this their lives were saved.
